dialogue.String: 1�Good day,  . The court had notified us about you.
1�But I'm afraid the ambassador is away at the moment.
1�You've heard of Delkfutt's Tower, have you not? The ambassador is presently inspecting that area. Her Excellency is scheduled to return soon, however.
1�Good day.
1�Why, Lord Wolfgang! To what do we owe this honor?
1�I seek audience with your ambassador.
1�I am sorry, but Her Excellency has gone to investigate Delkfutt's Tower.
1�Excuse me... Is the ambassador in residence?
1�The ambassador has a rare affliction, and it's time for a checkup.
1�I've told you before that diseases know no borders. Every patient needs a doctor; nationality and status matter not.
1�Advise your ambassador against these careless adventures. I shall return later. Good day.
1�Well, I can't give checkups without a patient. Please convey how sorry I was to miss the ambassador, and that I'll call again later.
1�Ah, but it is a good thing you are here! Why don't you go to Delkfutt's Tower and report on the ambassador's progress? A fitting task for the newcomer!
1�Tread lightly, as the place is crawling with fiends. It would behoove you to purchase arms in town, and to travel in the company of fellow adventurers.
1�Of course, you were promoted for a reason, so I have the utmost faith in your success. Best of luck to you!
1�Oh, it's you,  ... The administration gave us word of your coming.
1�Unfortunately, the ambassador isn't in right now.
1�You know where Delkfutt's Tower is, right? The ambassador's out investigating the area, but I think he's coming back soon.
1�Good day.
1�I seek audience with your ambassador.
1�Oh, yeah? Well, he's out investigating Delkfutt's Tower.
1�Excuse me... Is the ambassador in residence?
1�Monberaux! What business have you here?
1�Wolfgang. How have you been?
1�The ambassador has a rare affliction, and it's time for a checkup.
1�I've told you before that diseases know no borders. Every patient needs a doctor; nationality and status matter not.
1�Hmph. You haven't changed a bit, have you? You should take special care, my friend, lest you come to regret it.
1�Advise your ambassador against these careless adventures. I shall return later. Good day.
1�Well, I can't give checkups without a patient. Please convey how sorry I was to miss the ambassador, and that I'll call again later.
1�Hey, I know! You can go to Delkfutt's Tower and tell us how he's doing. Not too shabby for your first assignment, huh?
1�I hear that place is crawling with fiends! Be sure to gear up in town. And don't even think of going solo, either.
1�I know you've served your country well, so I'm confident you'll do fine. Go get 'em, soldier!
1�Why, hello,  . We'd received word you'd come.
1�But it's too bad; the ambassador's out right now.
1�You see, the ambassador has left for a survey of Delkfutt's Tower. I believe His Excellency should be back soon, though.
1�Good day.
1�I seek audience with your ambassador.
1�Oh? He's gone to investigate Delkfutt's Tower.
1�I would ask your ambassador to avoid such dangerous places... Or is it by order of your nation?
1�Excuse me... Is the ambassador in residence?
1�Wolfgang. How have you been?
1�The ambassador has a rare affliction, and it's time for a checkup.
1�I've told you before that diseases know no borders. Every patient needs a doctor; nationality and status matter not.
1�Hmph. You haven't changed a bit, have you? You should take special care, my friend, lest you come to regret it.
1�Advise your ambassador against these careless adventures. I shall return later. Good day.
1�Well, I can't give checkups without a patient. Please convey how sorry I was to miss the ambassador, and that I'll call again later.
1�Of course! Why don't you go to Delkfutt's Tower and see how he's doing? I know you just got here, but thanks!
1�We've heard that place houses fiends of foul stench! Stock up on new equipment in town, and make sure you've got a party to watch your back.
1�You've come this far, so I'm sure you'll do fine. Good luck!
1�You don't have 6����.
1�Stand down!
1�Nobody sees the sovereign without an appointment!
1�Stand down!
1�So, you're the new attach�i.
1�This is my brother. Don't let him bother you.
1�My sources tell me that beastmen in Davoi, Beadeaux, and Castle Oztroja are conspiring to return him to Vana'diel.
1�They seek to do so by harnessing the power of mysterious stones called magicite.
1�To stop their nefarious plan, I want you to go to those three places and seize that magicite.
1�So they're after magicite, are they? I wonder what this means... Take extra special care. The thought of a world under the control of the beastmen makes me shudder.
1�I bet the beastmen have traps waiting. First, you've got to find out as much as you can.
1�Eald'narche speaks the truth. Start by finding out what you can in town. I'm counting on you!
1�By the order of His Grace, we have decided to seek the assistance of the Tenshodo, the organization run by that Aldo fellow.
1�This secret dispatch outlines our wishes. Would you be so kind as to deliver it to him?
1�He is a man of many talents. It would be wise to seek his acquaintance. Good luck!
1�Now it is clear why the beastmen gathered where they did. They were drawn to the magicite's great power!
1�Yes, it is time to eradicate the beastman threat once and for all.
1�I thank you for your service. Here is 6����. With it, you may travel to any nation you please.
1�For now, I thank you for your service. Since you already have 6����, please accept this instead. May you spend it wisely.
1�The three stones are incomplete, but with the powers of the fourth stone that rests deep beneath Castle Zvahl...
1�Perhaps then the Shadow Lord will rise again.
1�Of course, the talisman that seals Zvahl's inner depths was put in place over twenty years ago. It would stop any attempt.
1�I've also read that the three keys to open the seal were kept safely by the three great nations...
1�Your Grace!
1�What is it?
1�Attacked... By beastmen?
1�Yes, Your Grace.
1�Confound them! They're one step ahead of us.
1�So, they seek to resurrect the Shadow Lord... Quite a lofty goal for beastmen.
1�So be it, then. Perhaps you should return to your embassy.
1�I will call for your aid again soon. Until then, be well.
1�Hey, what's going on? Oh, you don't have to tell me.
1�Oh, so you went to Castle Oztroja and met a girl named Verena there.
1�And she gets along with the beastmen. Wow, so maybe we could get along.
1�Hey, Wolfgang! Wolfie, you here?
1�Could you find someone named Verena and bring her here? I heard she's Aldo's little sister.
1�Of course, my lord. But may I ask why? She seems of...questionable intentions.
1�I think she has some nifty powers, so I just want to play with her. That's all.
1�Oh, and don't tell this to Kam'lanaut. I want to surprise him.
1�As you wish, my lord.
1�Heh. I can't wait!
1�No one is allowed to meet with the archduke or the ducal scientists unless it absolutely necessary.
1�The officials have been extremely busy making arrangements for numerous expeditionary forces to be sent to various locations around Quon and Mindartia.
1�Just a moment. I need to see your 3����...
1�Thank you. If the sovereign requests your audience, access to the chamber will be granted by the guards inside.
1�I'm sorry, but you will need 6���� to get in.
1�Have you received consent from the three nations?Not yet, you say? Then I suggest you get moving.
1�If you have any business with the archduke or the ducal scientists, please leave your message with us and we will relay it to the proper authorities.
1�However, we cannot guarantee that you will receive a hasty reply.
1�There is a man from the Alchemists' Guild who has been waiting to speak with the scientists for a number of days.
1�I believe he is still waiting somewhere near the archduke's quarters. Pour soul...
1�Just a moment. I need to see your 3����...
1�Thank you. If the sovereign requests your audience, access to the chamber will be granted by the guards inside.
1�I'm sorry, but you will need 6���� to get in.
1�You're an adventurer, right? So you've probably already heard about the humongous dragon that flew over the western skies.
1�At first everybody thought it might be a stray wyvern, but there are rumors that it was actually one of those ancient ��wyrms��!
1�I have heard news that the criminal accused of destroying the Telepoints was captured and taken into custody.

1�However, when questioned, �[he/she] said she had nothing to do with the incidents. To prove �[his/her] innocence, the Duchy has ordered the scoundrel to travel to the nations of Bastok, Windurst, and San d'Oria and gather information that will clear �[his/her] name.
1�The Jeuno Armada is readying for an attack on the Wyrmking, Bahamut. However, there is nothing to worry about. Our forces are the strongest, most advanced in all Vana'diel.
1�Not but a few moments ago, Sir Nag'molada passed by this station. However, he did not seem himself. I wonder if something is wrong...
1�Even Captain Wolfgang has been looking disturbed since he received that envelope. What ever could be going on?

1�The latest reports state the recent armada mission was a success. However, it did not completely stop the Wyrmking and his minions. It is rumored that the fleet will launch its second attack once the current repairs on the warships are completed.
1�Welcome. This is the home of the archduke, so please conduct yourself accordingly.
1�Where could this ��fated land�� be? I wouldn't even know where to start looking.
1�But now that I think of it, I could have sworn I heard that name somewhere before... Where was it...?
1�What?Is there a girl in Selbina with a serious case of amnesia?
1�How would I know? I'm always confined to my post here in Jeuno.You're the adventurer. Why don't you know these things?
1�Captain Wolfgang has asked me to remind you that you are to hurry to the Marble Bridge in Upper Jeuno.
1�It sounded as if it was urgent. You had best be on your way!
1�You want to know about the hooded officials in black robes that sometimes appear in the courtyard?
1�They are all members of the Armathrwn Society--scientists working for the Duchy. I have heard that there are even quite a few female members.
1�Have you seen a strange-looking boy or girl running about the gardens?
1�If you have, inform one of the Ducal Guards. There are currently warrrrants out for both of their arrrrests.
1�Their capture is crucial to the safety of not just Jeuno, but of all Vana'diel.You and your fellow adventurers' assistance in the matter is greatly appreciated.
1�If you have any information on the whereabouts of the girl the Duchy was searching for, I am sorry, but the warrant for her arrest has been dropped.
1�The Ducal Guard recently received news of her death...
1�Lords Kam'lanaut and Eald'narche rarely make public appearances.
1�And you need a special permit just to have an audience with them.
1�Both have kept their youth through all these years. Perhaps some otherworldly power watches over them. Great prophets like them are few indeed!
1�Did you know there is a mysterious group of officials in Jeuno known as the ��Armathrwn Society��?
1�The last time I tried telling some of the new recruits about the group, Captain Wolfgang put me on latrine duty for nine and a half weeks!
1�Members of the Armathrwn Society are to accompany the armada on its mission.It is said that the society's technological advancements are what built this city and made it what it is today.
1�Even with the technology of the Armathrwn Society on our side, the armada was unable to completely defeat the Wyrmking and his army. Perhaps we underestimated their power...
1�Say... You know Aldo, the guy who runs the organization called the Tenshodo?
1�Do you know him?Yes.No.
1�Oh, you're a Tenshodo member? I guess you know more than I do, then.
1�You should do business with the Tenshodo, too. They supply us with hard-to-find goods now and then.
1�The Tenshodo was founded by Aldo's father. They've done so well in trading abroad that they own the black market in these parts. Er, so I've heard...
1�Aldo took over after his father died. I've heard all kinds of things about him, but they say he's a smart and honorable man.
1� 's badge flashes brightly.
1�I see you've got a Salaheem's Sentinel badge there...They must be desperate to use those as an attention-grabbing device.
1�Maybe the empress of Aht Urhgan is short on devoted subjects...
1�Say... You know Aldo, the guy who runs the organization called the Tenshodo?
1�Say... You know Aldo, the guy who runs the organization called the Tenshodo?
1�I've heard rumors that a bright light shot out of the sea somewhere to the north of Delkfutt's Tower.

1�An investigatory party is scheduled to search the area for clues, but they'll have their work cut out for them. The currents in the Sea of Shu'Meyo are unpredictable and violent. Many a captain has lost his ship in those waters.
1�These grounds are the domain of Lords Kam'lanaut and Eald'narche. Please conduct yourself properly.
1�Sir Nag'molada often speaks with common people of the Duchy. I even heard that promotions are granted to those who happen to impress him.
1�I wonder if he will ever stop to speak with me... What would I say?
1�I know you may consider your nation a powerful force in Vana'diel, but Jeuno is the only nation with the resources to defeat the Wyrmking. Don't you forget it.
1�<Sigh>I requested a transfer from the Ducal Guard to the armada crew, but I was turned down...
1�Why do I have to stand around the gardens while everyone else is having all the fun? Look at these biceps! I could take out a wyrm with one blow!Well...maybe two blows.
1�Have you ever met Lord Eald'narche? He's still a lad, but the archduke's brother is gifted with incredible talents.
1�Jeuno is safe as long as it has Archduke Kam'lanaut and Lord Eald'narche.
1�The three great nations preach friendship, but beneath the facade is a struggle for supremacy. Nobody can tell what will come of it.
1�That is why we must focus on our duties. There is no guarantee that the reign of peace we enjoy now will last.
1� 's badge flashes brightly.
1�Lately, the Empire of Aht Urhgan has been building up her army. That's sure to make waves internationally...
1�Do you think we can continue to preserve friendly relations with all three major nations as the balance of power hangs by a thread?
1�You, a scruffy adventurer, spoke with Sir Nag'molada!?
1�Did you know that he was a high-ranking member of the prestigious Armathrwn Society--the advisors to Archduke Kam'lanaut?
1�Lady Esha'ntarl is supposedly leading the mission against Bahamut. With such a skilled commander at the armada's helm, there isn't anything in Vana'diel that can stop the Duchy!
1�In its first wave of attacks, the armada was successful in dealing a large amount of damage to Bahamut. The Wyrmking will not stand a chance against the second wave.
1�Did you know that Lord Eald'narche wears an eye patch? He had an accident when he was little, but it hasn't fazed him! Bless his heart.
1�In the chaos of war, the archduke had a brilliant plan. He believed that the three nations' only chance was to cast aside their squabbles and stand as one.
1�Each nation had to shoulder an equal burden in the struggle against the beastmen. His strategy was truly brilliant!
1�Without his guidance, this world would have turned to shadow under the domination of the beastmen.
1�In the past, there was a terrible war. My father once told me how the earth, swept by furious winds, was soaked in the blood of the fallen.
1�I heard his tales every time he drowned his sorrows in drink. Now his stories are etched in my mind.
1� 's badge flashes brightly.
1�The Near East must be in a dire condition to send mercenary recruiters all the way to Jeuno...
1�I heard many tales of the Great War from my dear departed father. They all seemed irrelevant to me until now...
1�Sir Wolfgang's father was a famous soldier, too. He commanded Jeuno's forces in the Crystal War, and his exploits are legendary.
1�After the war, he looked after the families of his fallen comrades. What a great man... There's more to being a soldier than just brute strength!
1�This is the entrance to Jeuno's Rent-a-Rooms. Press the button near the central pillar to go inside.
1�This is the entrance to Jeuno's residential area. Do you want to move your belongings to a Rent-a-Room here?
1�Do you want to move to Jeuno?Yes.No.
1�Very well. I've completed the necessary procedures. You'll find a button near the central pillar. Press it to enter.
1�If you ever feel like moving, just ask me.
1�Strange whirlpools in Valkurm and Qufim...Shattered Telepoints...What could it all mean?
1�From what I gather, the ducal scientists believe this phenomenon has something to do with the shattered Telepoints at the Crags of Holla, Dem, and Mea.
1�The investigatory report written by the Ducal Guards mentioned that the whirlpools in Valkurm and Qufim are made up of an unknown substance that they call the ��Emptiness.��

1�And now there are rumors stating that by jumping into these dark vortexes, people can instantly teleport themselves to the lost island of Tavnazia!I don't know about you, but I am staying right here where it is safe!
1�While the Jeuno Armada is making preparations for battle, it remains the duty of the Ducal Guard to ensure the safety of the citizens of Jeuno.
1�One of the armada warships is missing!With all the tightened security, how could anyone have pulled off a feat as grand as stealing an airship!?
1�While the Jeuno Armada is conducting its mission in the skies, it remains the duty of the Ducal Guard to ensure the safety of the citizens of Jeuno.
1�This the hall of the Ducal Guards. Only the finest warriors may join. Come to think of it, this is no place for civilians like you.
1�Sir Wolfgang is our leader. He was selected not just for his skill at arms, but also for his unwavering determination.
1�What could be the purpose for this meeting being held at the Marble Bridge in Upper Jeuno?
1�If that Aldo is involved, I am positive it cannot be anything good. Just keep me out of it. If I lose this job, I'm through!
1�Those three Tarutaru brought to Jeuno by Nag'molada have been granted amnesty by Lady Esha'ntarl.
1�However, I don't believe they have much of a future here in the Duchy.
1�Once you have angered  �[the Armathrwn Society/the archduke], it would take no less than a miracle to regain  �[their/his] trust.
1�Recently, there have been no signs of Nag'molada or those annoying Tarutaru entering the Grand Duke Palace.
1�I heard from one of the guards that the Tarutaru were seen riding an airship to Bastok, but as for Nag'molada...
1�Ah, that energetic young Elvaan girl just entered the audience chamber.Hmmm... I thought she had been taken into custody...
1�With all the preparations for the launch of the armada, there are currently few people remaining in the Grand Palace. I wonder who gave the girl permission to enter...
1�The airship Endymion is all fueled up and going through a final flight check.
1�Are you ready for deployment,  ?
1�Are you ready?Ready.Not yet.
1�Understood.I have orders from Sir Wolfgang to hold the Endymion at port until you are aboard.
1�Please inform me when your preparations are complete.
1�Very well.Please continue into the courtyard.
1�The other members of your team are assembled and waiting.Everyone except your mission leader...Naji, was it?

1�Wow, you all got here fast...
1�Or am I a little late?
1�YoU aRe��LAte, TeAM LeaDEr��NaJi!
1�My apologies.I brought a secret weapon from Bastok, and had a devil of a time getting it unwrapped...
1�SEcrEt��weAPoN?TheRE aRe��nO sEcrEts aMOnG��thIS tEAm!
1�Eh? Oh, fine then.
1�This is an astral detection device designed by Chief Engineer Cid.
1�I don't really understand how it works exactly, but apparently it will help us zone in on the general location of Luzaf or the iron colossus.
1�We dO NoT��rEquiRE aNy��sUCh ToY.YoU hAVe��acCEsS tO tHE��LatESt tEChnoLOgY��fROm wiNDurSt.
1�Toys? That's rich, coming from an overgrown spinning top.
1�HoW daRE��yOU adDReSs��tHE KiNg iN��sUCh a mANneR!
1�Enough of this prattling.We are not here for fun and games. If preparations have been made, then I suggest we move out.
1�Wait up,  . I'm on strict orders from Captain Volker to stick by your side at all times!
1�PRoViSionAL��JaCk! Do nOT LEaVe��yoUR KiNg��bEHiNd!
1�Did you hear? Some of the Telepoint crystals in Holla, Mea, and Dem have broken into a million pieces!
1�So that's why Captain Wolfgang has been on edge lately... But what is really going on at those crags?
1�Did you hear that a super-secret weapon was being loaded onto one of the warships? I wonder what it could be...
1�Yes, I overheard some of the other guards mention that the society's scientists had built a terrifying new battle machine.
1�Alright! After using that contraption, along with the airships' ultra-powerful mammoth cannons, there won't be enough left of those wyrms to even make dragon burgers!
1�Did you find out anything more about the super-secret weapon the armada took with them?
1� No... However, I did hear that the device dealt a severe blow to the mighty Wyrmking during the assault.
1�Wowzie! If I had an ultra-spiffy contraption like that, I'd be eating roast dragon burgers every night!
1�Sometimes I see the darndest things here. One time, a rookie of ours got cursed in the necropolis of Eldieme, and I didn't know what to do.
1�Once I took a new guy to the Eldieme Necropolis, and he got cursed there. He went berserk, and had this unstoppable craving for raw meat.
1�Well, I gave it some thought... And you know those torches in the rooms made of stone? Well, I heard that spirits hate them...
1�So, I figured it might help if I lit a lantern with those flames and brought it here.That's how we saved the guy.
1�But, uh... I've also heard that some spirits actually like that kind of fire. So, it might not always be such a good idea.
1�I guess we were lucky then. We had no idea what else to do, and just wanted to do what we could.
1�If you want, we can lend you the lantern we used back then. What do you say?
1�Do you want to borrow the lantern?Yes, please.Not now.
1�Try and bring back the flames in this lantern. We don't know what else could help.
1�I seem to remember there were four torches, and that you had to light them in the proper order.
1�Yeah, that's right. I remember screwing that up. Too bad I forgot the real order, though. Well, I'm sure you can figure it out.
1�Oh, yeah? Well, you're free to use it any time.
1�Try and bring back the flames in this lantern. We don't know what else could help.
1�Don't forget it's the stone-wrought room that you're after. The torches in the caverns are for something else, so don't mix them up.
1�Oh, the flame thing didn't work, huh? Well, I'm just glad the spirit's gone!
1�Yep, I knew it. You learn something every day. I'm gonna write this up in the Guardsman's Daily.
1�I bet things are brewing that are way too crazy for us to imagine.
1�If you knew exactly which spirit is doing the possessing, then you can figure out how to exorcise it. But that's the last resort, you know?
1�I always wondered how someone of his height lit that lantern.
1� 's badge flashes brightly.
1�Hm? I see you have one of those brass badges that Salaheem's Sentinels are handing out unauthorized. Let me take a look at it.

1�Interesting. Objects from the Near East seem to shine with a different light.I've heard that the president of Salaheem's Sentinels is quite tight-fisted, but at least this badge is quite luxurious.
1�The archduke hosts so many dignitaries, every night is a banquet. Composing original menus makes me fret!
1� 's badge flashes brightly.
1�Near Eastern cuisine is all the rage now.Lately I've been studying up on it to add some spice to the palace banquets.
1�Near Eastern cooking is considered one of the leading cuisines in Vana'diel, so I am sure the archduke will be most pleased.
1�This is the archduke's chamber. Only here can he find refuge from his busy schedule...
1�But he's always out, doing his best for the Duchy. We all look up to him so much. His deeds benefit not only Jeuno, but the entire world as well.
1�All I can do in return is change his sheets and prepare hot soup.
1�These works are part of Lord Eald'narche's collection. His Lordship is versed in history as well as art.
1�The archduke and his brother often relax in this room. We always wait outside, but they do seem to get along quite well.
1�I do not pry into their conversations, but their knowledge of politics, culture, and philosophy rivals that of scholars.
1�This monument was built at the end of the war...as a reminder that nobody should suffer like that ever again.
1�And now, people forget the mistakes of the past and quarrel all over again. I bet this is the only place where that promise is still remembered.
1�I want somebody to take this map I got in the north and stave off impending disaster, but you don't look ready for such a task.
1�Maybe you can take this 3���� I got in the north, and stave off impending disaster... Do you think you've got what it takes?
1�What do you say?I can do it.Not now.
1�I knew you were the one! Now bring me  $���� and show me what you're made of!
1�Well, that's a bummer. I thought you just might be the one!
1�Bring me  $����. I'm counting on you!
1�Don't forget our vow here. Remember how precious peace is.
1�Good job! I knew you could do it. But be on your guard.
1�Well, if they can tear down the clock tower, who knows what they'll do to the monument? Quick, where do I sign?
1�The petition is now complete.

1�You have 
� more ��[signature/signatures] to go.
1�Would you care to see a map of Greater Jeuno?
1�What do you say?Show me.Not now.
1�We stand in the gardens of Ru'Lude, at the very top of Jeuno's superstructure.
1�A mighty fine palace, this is. Why, it's like a castle in the clouds! I'm so glad I came all this way to see it.

1�Auction houses can be found in all of Vana'diel's major cities. Here adventurers gather to bid on battle spoils, unwanted items, old armor...almost anything.
1�Adventurers may use any auction house regardless of nationality.
1�The first adventurer to bid at or above the asking price will automatically purchase the product.
1�Once put up for auction, merchandise will remain there for a maximum of thirty weeks Vana'diel time (nine-and-a-half days Earth time).
1�If merchandise does not sell within this time limit, it will be returned to the seller's current residence.
1�Transaction fees are proportional to the amount for which an item is put up on auction. The method of calculating this fee is different for single items and stackable items.
1�A transaction fee is collected when any merchandise is put up for auction. This fee is nonrefundable.
1�The International Auction House Committee, or IAHC, has declared that a maximum of seven items may be put up for auction at one time.

1�A small amount of time is required before new merchandise appears on our bid list.
1�Once an item appears on your ��Sales Status�� list, it may not immediately appear on the bid list. If you do not see your item on the bid list, try looking again at a later time.

1�To remove an item from your ��Sales Status�� list, you must visit an auction counter to acknowledge the sale or return of your merchandise.

1�At any auction counter, open the ��Sales Status�� menu and acknowledge the transaction to clear it from the list.
